website_summaries.verdict: Wireless technology provides a high-sensory experience designed for your baby's safety.
pros: Fits under the mattress versus having to secure on your baby's sleepwear
Multi-functional and allows for customized settings, including alarm-only mode
Reviewers give high remarks for the duration of the charge
cons: Requires a flat surface to function properly

customer_reviews.title: Miss the old version
customer_reviews.text: The design of the hand-held part is really annoying. It falls over all the time. And even worse when it’s plugged in. It plugs in at the bottom which throws it off balance and then falls face forward waking the baby. I had the old version and LOVED it. I was hoping this one would be just amazing but it’s not. You have to push three buttons to turn off the sensor where the old version you just had to push a button down.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Adams

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you have a little one
customer_reviews.text: We have had 2 NICU babies and that in itself was hard. This angel care system gave us peace of mind once we brought them home. Setup was pretty simple. the buttons are very easy to read and use in the night. never a false reading and now I have 3 babies that have made it past the crib stage and we are no longer worrying about anything. Thank you Angel care
customer_reviews.author: Ashely lemoine

customer_reviews.title: Lovely little monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have used older versions of this for my first child. I like the updates. Our unit does give a lot of false alarms but we haven't actually done any troubleshooting (there are instructions for that) I either deal with it or turn the motion detector off. All in all, I like this monitor, has what wanted from previous monitors, you can turn the tic(beeping) off, you can turn so many features off and on, just need to read the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Warren

customer_reviews.title: Bummer of a product
customer_reviews.text: We had an older wired model for our first child which for the most part worked really well. We tried this model for our newborn a few times but it just kept going off, no matter the sensitivity setting. Also this model may look fancier but it comes with usability trade offs such as power on/off being a slider on the old model, but a difficult-to-find-in-the-night small button next to a larger button on this new model.
customer_reviews.author: M Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work well with smaller baby.
customer_reviews.text: We used this product with our nicu baby (4.5lb )and she was too small for this to work properlyso we had to be a belly clip monotor. It would pick up our footsteps over her light breathing and turning it on and off was a pain. This would be great if you have an bigger baby 6+months or an escapee toddler.
customer_reviews.author: UserSs

customer_reviews.title: Versatile monitor for sound and movement. Easy to take on the road.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a second monitor for my downstairs area that the baby naps. Super easy set up and so far very accurate no false alarms. Previously had the wired version love the versatility of the wireless!
customer_reviews.author: Marydale Farm

customer_reviews.title: Great for twins
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one and the one without the audio for a friend who is having twins. She is so relieved to have this and already setup under the mattress.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor I've found
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this monitor. I bought it to replace a tommy tippie one that broke and it works perfectly. I love the parent monitor. Its loud and it has a talk back mix built in. Definitely worth the money and it wireless to the crib!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement over wired version
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. It is a big improvement over the old wired version. Very easy to set up and less false alarms than before.
customer_reviews.author: M. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Broken in one year
customer_reviews.text: We barely used the motion sensor because we were always setting it off in the middle of the night. I think the quality isn't very good either. Digital Audio Parent unit broken in a year, you can hear the pieces rattling around :( Doesn't work at all now. I liked that it gave the temp of the nursery though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as user friendly as I’d like, too sensitive, but a great back up.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Bachmann

customer_reviews.title: Great peace of mind!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor has given us such a peace of mind at night. Our son is a belly sleeper & has been since he was 4 weeks old. Love this monitor!
customer_reviews.author: Denelle Billman

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with this monitor. We had one with our oldest, and the wireless one is a great improvement. The adjustable sensitivity is great, it is able to sense my babies weight with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Frogmom

customer_reviews.title: Nursery Unit only works with batteries
customer_reviews.text: My nursery unit only works with batteries. I have to buy lots of batteries to keep it working. Because I purchased the item since we found that we were pregnant, my order is nos eligible to return any more. I would like that Angelcare helps me with this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like this but I got about 6 false alarms the first night, not user friendly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I sleep so much better having a piece of mind. Easy to set up and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Balyeat

customer_reviews.title: This produce could save a child life.
customer_reviews.text: This produce is for my great grandchild, this is a must for every parent, great produce.
customer_reviews.author: Becky E.

customer_reviews.title: Missing critical part
customer_reviews.text: This is missing the main power for the pad itself and did not come with all the parts needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very annoying while trying to keep the baby asleep
customer_reviews.text: Hard to use. The alarm constantly goes off. Very annoying while trying to keep the baby asleep. For a first time buy I suppose it was a good idea but i would not of bought.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo 💖 Sam Hurtado

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: This has it all! A movement sensor, a 2 way monitor AND a temperature sensor! If you are a paranoid parent, this is going to set your mind at ease!!! As the parent of a baby who would often stop breathing, this monitor is worth its weight in gold! Once you have experienced that with one child, you never stop worrying with future children. With this I can put baby down and know that he is fine. I really love that they put this all into one unit, so there is no need for multiple different devices. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Oceania

customer_reviews.title: Great but broke after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product and is great to use and accurate. Gave it a lesser rating because after about 10 months the parent monitor port where you plug in to charge it broke. Now we can no longer use because it doesnt charge anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Berdahl

customer_reviews.title: 2 parent units have gone bad in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Parent unit stopped charging after two months of use...purchased a replacement parent unit that has just stopped charging as well right at it’s two month mark. Unit not alarming even when the baby is out of the crib and unit is still on (sensitivity is set appropriately)
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Deemer

customer_reviews.title: Good baby monitor, receiver's maximum volume isn't very high
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a very good baby monitor. The receiver is small and holds a charge for several hours. We end up needing to charge ours once every two or three days. The sound comes through clearly, and the talk-back feature is helpful from time to time. My one complaint is that the maximum volume isn't as high as I would like. It's fine if you're in a relatively quiet room with it, but it's not the sort of thing that you can leave sitting on a table in one room and expect to hear what's going on if you go one or two rooms away for a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Eric and Liz Aderhold

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and set up, this monitor gives parents an extra level of security with their newborns.
customer_reviews.author: KasaC

product_meta.title: Angelcare Baby Monitor with Sound and Wireless Sensor Pad AC117
product_meta.description: Angelcare's AC117 movement and sound monitor allows parents to relax while baby is resting. Our patented Sensor Pad is designed to be placed under baby's crib mattress where it senses subtle movements while baby sleeps. The AC117 also includes our new low-profile, Nursery Unit with audio/temperature sensor unit and a newly designed Parent Unit. The system features a digital temperature read-out on the Parent Unit and two-way audio.
feature_bullets: Under-the-mattress wireless Movement Sensor Pad tracks subtle movements (like breathing) that audio and video monitors can't detect* (This product is intended to be used only for parental reassurance to monitor your baby’s movements.)
Alarm will sound if no movement is detected after 20 seconds
Nursery Unit with LED ring that glows: blue (cold), red (warm), or white (just right)
Room temperature display on Parent Unit
Secure digital transmission of 1.9GHz, up-to 230m out-of-range (open field)
Tabletop stand for the Nursery Unit
Battery or mains operated - Ideal for travelling

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars63 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
